data.title: Where and how to watch Eredivisie 2023-24 in UK?
data.meta_description: The Eredivisie 2023-24 marks the 68th season of the Dutch first-division football competition. Where and how to watch Eredivisie 2023-24 in UK?
data.text:
Feyenoord are the defending champions of the Eredivisie

The Eredivisie 2023-24 marks the 68th season of the Dutch first-division football competition. The Dutch League is now one of the top five leagues in Europe. This season started on 11 August 2023 and will conclude on 19 May.

Feyenoord won the league in the 2022-23 season. They finished ahead of PSV, Ajax and AZ Alkmaar in the league standings.

Ajax are the most successful team in the league. The team from Amsterdam has won 34 league titles, with the last coming in the 2021-22 season. This season things have been miserable for the Dutch giants. They sit at the bottom of the league after eight games.

PSV have started the season well and have a 100% record in the first 10 league games. AZ Alkmaar, Twente and Feyenoord are the other title contenders at the end of the 10th game week.

Vangelis Pavlidis of AZ Alkmaar is leading the goal-scoring standings ahead of Santiago Gimenez of Feyenoord.

Which teams are playing in the Eredivisie in 2023â€“24?

Ajax, Almere City, Az Alkmaar, Excelisor, Feyenoord, Foruna Sittard, Go Ahead Eagles, SC Heerenveen, Heracles Almelo, NEC Nijmegen, PEC Zwolle, PSV, RKC Waalwijk, Spara Rotterdam, FC Twente, FC Urecht, Vitesse and FC Volendam.

Heracles Almelo, PEC Zwolle, and Almere City (promoted for the first time in their history to Eredivisie) were promoted from the second division.

After 23 years in the Eredivisie, FC Groningen were relegated to the Eerste Divisie, alongside SC Cambuur after two years and FC Emmen after one year.

The last two teams get automatically relegated from the league. The team finishing above these two teams will play a relegation play-off.

Where and how to watch the Eredivisie 2023-24 season in UK?

You can watch the Dutch Eredivisie live on Mola TV.
